ComicInfo.Title: Just for Kicks; Tale of Two Kitties; Blue Who? Part Two: On the Beam; Blue Who?; Teamwork!; Top Dog vs. Frank 'n' Stein; Strong Impressions; Corn-ered; Elasticat
ComicInfo.Summary:
Just for Kicks: Heathcliff gets pretty aggressive (and creative) when the Kung Fu Film Festival is in town.
Tale of Two Kitties: When Heathcliff bullies a new cat on the block, Iggy's friend Marcy tells a story about King Arthurcliff in the time of Catelot who learned to get along with Mr. Dusty despite their differences.
Blue Who? Part Two: On the Beam: Funshine Bear saves the day as he leads his forest animal friends against the Gloomies, who just don't know how to have fun.
Blue Who?: Swift Heart Rabbit comes to tell the Care Bears that something is wrong in the Forest of Feelings, which has turned blue. Three bears travel back with him to see how they can help, but when they arrive, Funshine Bear is beamed up into the Gloomies' spaceship.
Teamwork!: When his team's football players keep getting injured, mascot Heathcliff takes over for the coach and sends the coach in as a replacement.
Top Dog vs. Frank 'n' Stein: Mervin orders his mad scientist employees to make Top Dog prefer Mervin to Joey, but Top Dog turns out to be more than they can handle.
Strong Impressions: Heathcliff snatches a bag of peanuts away from some parading elephants and they chase him through wet cement.
Corn-ered: Colonel Corn, a corn cob mutated by the RUIN Labs' toxic pod, captures Tommy and the other children. Colonel Corn explains to them that he has been "corn-sidering" taking over the world. Fed up with his constant corn-related puns, the Madballs defeat him by forcing him to pop his kernels.
Elasticat: Heathcliff visits the cat food factory where his scientist friends let hm test their new flavors. He finds their new experimental formula more tasty, but later discovers that it's turned him stretchy. He uses his new powers to help Iggy's team with a basketball game but they wear off before he can do a more thorough demonstration.
